title.en: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 5 - Vento Aureo

altTitles.ro: Aventurile Bizare ale lui JoJo Partea 5: Vântul de Aur

altTitles.ja-ro: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Dai 5 Bu Giorno Giovana: Ōgon naru Isan
JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Ougon no Kaze

altTitles.en: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 5 - Giorno Giovanna: Golden Heritage

altTitles.es: La extraña aventura de JoJo Parte 5: El viento dorado

altTitles.ja: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 - 黄金の風

altTitles.pt-br: A Aventura Bizarra de JoJo: Parte 5 - Vento Dourado

altTitles.en: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 5: Golden Wind

altTitles.ja: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 第5部 ジョルノ・ジョバァーナ【黄金なる遺産】

description.en:
Naples, 2001. Giorno Giovanna is a small-time crook with one big dream—to become a "Gang-Star." No ordinary thief, Giorno has a connection to the remarkable Joestar bloodline, and possesses a Stand named Gold Experience. His dream starts to become reality when he meets Bruno Bucciarati, a mobster from the gang Passione and a fellow Stand user himself. Realizing that they share similar ideals, and both disagree with the gang's harmful affairs, Giorno reveals his goal to Bruno: with Bruno's help, he will reform Passione by overthrowing the boss.  
  
As Giorno becomes a member of Passione, and is inducted into Bruno's squad, he discovers that it is no simple gang; its numbers are teeming with Stand users. Now confronted by other squads of differing loyalties and unpredictable caliber, their goal to change the gang from the inside out will be a tough one. Taking on these adversaries, Giorno attempts to rise through the ranks and inch closer to the boss, a man who is shrouded in mystery.

[Official English](https://www.viz.com/read/manga/jojo-s-bizarre-adventure-part-5-golden-wind/all)
description.pt-br:
Vento Aureo é o quinto arco do mangá de JoJo's Bizarre Adventures. É estrelado por Giorno Giovana. 

Giorno está determinado a subir ao topo do crime organizado e se tornar um gangster cabeça, a fim de ajudar as pessoas e tornar o mundo um lugar melhor. Assim, ele se junta Passione, um grupo de crime organizado, que emprega muitos usuários de stands...

biography.en:
**Hirohiko Araki** (荒木 飛呂彦, born June 7, 1960) is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, which was first published in Weekly Shōnen Jump in 1987 and has sold over 100 million copies as of 2016 in Japan alone.

Araki participated in the Junior Baseball Team in primary school and Kendo Club in middle school. He has a pair of twin younger sisters. Because he was often bullied by his sister, he would hide away to read manga. He liked manga when he was a child, so he wants to be a manga artist. His favorite works are Star of the Giants by Kajiwara Ikki , and Babel II by Yokoyama. Araki had the experience of shaking hands with Tezuka Osamu.

He likes western pop music, horror movies and Italy very much. We can see a lot of the above elements in his representative work JOJO.His painting style was influenced by Renaissance paintings, especially Michelangelo.

He gets up at 10 a.m. every day, draws a Name on Sunday, finishes the draft from Monday to Thursday, rests on Friday and Saturday, and doesn't stay up late. This work and rest lasted more than ten years . The work and rest of this law is influenced by the manga artist [Akimoto Osamu](https://mangadex.org/author/1cd79d33-68b3-4879-b67a-834055ef99eb/akimoto-osamu). Although he is over 50, his face does not show his old state. He is even joked by other manga artists and fans as "the younger he lives", "Immortality", "using corrugation or stone ghost face", "in fact, he is also a Stand, and his ability is that he will not grow old".
